core_exploration.central_question: How do I calculate net worth when assets generate income that changes their effective value?
core_exploration.key_tension: Static asset valuation versus dynamic cash flow generation in wealth assessment
core_exploration.breakthrough_moment: Recognition that the rental property fundamentally changes the debt equation by being self-sustaining
core_exploration.edge_of_understanding: How to properly weight income-generating assets in net worth calculations

conceptual_dna: Assets that pay for themselves transform from liabilities into wealth-building engines
Net worth calculation becomes complex when static values meet dynamic cash flows

bridge_potential.novel_synthesis: Integrating cash flow analysis with traditional net worth calculation
bridge_potential.cross_domain_pattern: Self-sustaining systems change the fundamental equation of value assessment

raw_essence: The person is grappling with how to properly calculate net worth when one major asset (rental property) generates income that covers its own costs, recognizing this fundamentally changes the traditional debt-to-asset equation.
embedding_text: net worth calculation rental property cash flow self-sustaining assets mortgage debt income generation financial valuation dynamic versus static wealth assessment
